## Out of Scope

List the features discussed which are out of scope or might be revisited in a later release.

-

Running iterations on a different date:

[https://invent.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/3712548955/pages/4045111299/](https://invent.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/3712548955/pages/4045111299/)

Observing Elasticity:

We created a workflow for taking easier iterations on a new date . By “a new date” we mean an earlier date that has different properties from the current iteration performed. For example, you ran your iterations in 2023-11-05, where a 3 month forecast will cover black friday, christmas and new years sales. But what if you would like to see how your model performs in a setting where you will cover Ramadan and Eid Al-Adha. You could run this workflow to setup the tables that will allow you to make forecast iterations.

# Important Note:

1-) This workflow is reliant on creating another noob folder that is allocated only for the specific run_date you wish to run forecasts. That is why you need to change the `noob_home` variable in the `metadata_config.yml` you are using in Databricks. Be very careful, not changing the `noob_home `variable will overwrite the tables in your datastore.

metadata.title: Workflow for taking iterations on a new date

content:
Be very careful, not changing the `noob_home `variable will overwrite the tables in your datastore.

2-) Creating and running the noob_etl and noob_chain_weekly dags in production before this will help you to create the flow you wish without an error.

In order to take a run with an earlier date, you need to create tables in that earlier date, like you are at date and making a prediction. You can do that by creating a similar workflow at the top, and modify according to your needs.

Two required tasks to achieve this are:

NoobEtlEarlierDate: Where you can create the tables that are created in the noob-etl .

NoobChainWeeklyEarlierDate: Where you can create the tables that are created in noob_chain_weekly dag.

These are just a notebooks that will allow you to run the required modules. You have to make the customer specific extensions and config changes.

metadata.title: Workflow for taking iterations on a new date

content:
u to run the required modules. You have to make the customer specific extensions and config changes.

Other tasks can be run here that is required in long term forecast. In Fiba instance, we included seasonality and speed clusters as features, therefore before running NoobChainWeeklyEarlierDate, we ran the notebooks that will create the required tables.

Databricks Job Link: [https://inventanalytics-fiba.cloud.databricks.com/?o=5872417667248434#job/983794599796190/tasks](https://inventanalytics-fiba.cloud.databricks.com/?o=5872417667248434#job/983794599796190/tasks)

NoobEtlEarlierDate Notebook Link: [https://inventanalytics-fiba.cloud.databricks.com/?o=5872417667248434#notebook/2518434472745905/command/2518434472745917](https://inventanalytics-fiba.cloud.databricks.com/?o=5872417667248434#notebook/2518434472745905/command/2518434472745917)

Workflow for taking iterations on a new date

content:
1-) Wait for ETL to finish for latest data

2-) Generate targets [https://adb-3902171999061009.9.azuredatabricks.net/?o=3902171999061009#notebook/3714586174624151/command/2862892905449691](https://adb-3902171999061009.9.azuredatabricks.net/?o=3902171999061009#notebook/3714586174624151/command/2862892905449691), just change RUN_DATE to 2024-10-17 should be enough (running until # Sales Curve for markdown.ItemSeasonalityEffects table) markdown cell is enough

3-) Update Price Steps for New scope here:

[https://adb-3902171999061009.9.azuredatabricks.net/?o=3902171999061009#notebook/1402072047574255/command/3561459003353151](https://adb-3902171999061009.9.azuredatabricks.net/?o=3902171999061009#notebook/1402072047574255/command/3561459003353151)

just running should be enough. (dont forget to wait until etl finished, otherwise this wouldnt work as intended)

4-) Run the SQL scripts

SetMarkdownST Targets: Running should be enough

wouldnt work as intended)

4-) Run the SQL scripts

SetMarkdownST Targets: Running should be enough

Generate EOL Passed Items Script: just make sure Rundate is correct

5 -) Take runs in three part, note the run ids (X, X+1,X+2)

6-) Create Results table: [https://adb-3902171999061009.9.azuredatabricks.net/editor/notebooks/3114910995287145?o=3902171999061009#command/3023553887567323](https://adb-3902171999061009.9.azuredatabricks.net/editor/notebooks/3114910995287145?o=3902171999061009#command/3023553887567323)

6-) Notes: RTV’d backpack items, after the run, put SuggestedPrice = Current Cluster Price

GuardRail: could be set by altering the SellthroughOffTargetPoint1, SellthroughOffTargetPoint2, SellthroughOffTargetPoint3  at Caleres.markdown.BenchmarkMarkdownParameters. Step map i

Notes: No Tenure Exists currently. Setting Tenure = 1 at Caleres.markdown.BenchmarkMarkdownParameters should do the trick, unfortunately I could not create tenure feature for EOL Passed Items
